thread.title_full: Fog Disrupts Rail: Fog Disrupts Rail and Air Services in Lucknow | Lucknow News - Times of India

author: Times Of India
title: Fog Disrupts Rail: Fog Disrupts Rail and Air Services in Lucknow | Lucknow News - Times of India
text: Lucknow: Dense fog threw life out of gear on Thursday disrupting flight and train services connecting the state capital with neighboring towns and the rest of the country. 14 domestic flights in and out of Lucknow were cancelled. It included eight departures and six arrivals. Flights arriving from Pune, Delhi, Kolkata, Bengaluru, Hyderabad and Nagpur were cancelled. Fights departing from Lucknow, including for Delhi, Amritsar, Kolkata, Bengaluru, Hyderabad, Indore and Patna were also cancelled. Two other flights from Mumbai bound for Lucknow were diverted to Delhi and Jaipur. Garib Rath from Gorakhpur was late by 1 hour 30 minutes. Ayodhya Cantt-Delhi express was late by one hour, Lucknow Mail was late by 3 and half hours and New Delhi-Lucknow AC superfast express was delayed by 2 hours and 40 minutes. Varanasi-New Delhi Vande Bharat Express, Lucknowâ€“New Delhi Swarn Shatabdi Express and New Delhi-Lucknow Swarn Shatabdi Express remained cancelled on Thursday. We also published the following articles recentlyBrace for dense to very dense fog in Lucknow todayLucknow experienced the first 'cold day' condition of winter, breaking the warm spell. Thick fog caused near zero visibility, obstructing sun rays. A weak western disturbance changed wind pattern to moisture-laden easterly, causing dense fog. Another stronger disturbance will hit on Saturday, causing snow in Jammu & Kashmir. UP will have partly cloudy sky and increased wind velocity. This will decrease fog density.106362725Dense fog engulfs Delhi-NCR; flights, trains delayedDelhi experienced dense fog with temperatures dropping to 7 degrees Celsius, causing reduced visibility. The primary weather station in Safdarjung recorded visibility of 200 meters, while Palam had only 100 meters. Delhi airport reported delays for 30 flights due to fog. The air quality index in the national capital was recorded at 374, falling into the \"very poor\" category.106281393
